channel.title: New Client unRenamer v1.1
channel.description:
ok, since jagex checks if we run the client unrenamed, this simply unRenames the client :D
I wrote the code to parse zkm's changeLog into a readable form for pd's bytecode renamer, so all anyone has to do when writing a bot/client/etc is rename as they wish (just make sure to also rename the conf file) and after they compile the code this will rename your bytecode back to jagex spec, including the overridden methods (I would just run the code in your compile script right after javac)
well at least that problem is solved ;D hope it helps

item.title: New Client unRenamer v1.1
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Good job mopar ^^ never tought we’d ever need an unrenamer

Read full topic

item.title: New Client unRenamer v1.1
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ive fixed the problem with the overridden methods, turns out as always Im an idiot and while working on my mauser in the garage I realized I could simply use a string to store the methods in to avoid entirely the problem of the properties class and keys, but oh well, its fixed now

and for those of you wondering what this is for: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3430.msg33533.html#msg33533

note krichevskoy’s rule #2 Thout shalt not run this client renamed!

Read full topic
